Title: Senior Product Manager, Data
RoleDescription:
MongoDBs mission is to empower innovators to create, transform, and disrupt industries by unleashing the power of software and data. We enable organizations of all sizes to easily build, scale, and run modern applications by helping them modernize legacy workloads, embrace innovation, and unleash AI. Our industry-leading developer data platform, MongoDB Atlas, is the only globally distributed, multi-cloud database and is available in more than 115 regions across AWS, Google Cloud, and Microsoft Azure. Atlas allows customers to build and run applications anywhereon premises, or across cloud providers. With offices worldwide and over 175,000 new developers signing up to use MongoDB every month, its no wonder that leading organizations, like Samsung and Toyota, trust MongoDB to build next-generation, AI-powered applications.
As a Product Manager on our IT Data team - comprising Data Pipeline Engineering, Data Platform Engineering, Data Architecture, and Data Governance & Discoverability - you will have the opportunity to work on data products that MongoDB employees use everyday to make decisions and accelerate product growth. Our teams own the Internal Data Platform that provides analytics and data science capabilities to the entire company, as well as the raw and transformed data assets that underpin it. Current data products include our data lake query engine, self-serve pipeline tooling, data catalog, data quality service, lifecycle management tool and more. As our surface area and user base continue to grow, you'll have the chance to take ownership of our Internal Data Platform portfolio and lead it to new heights.
We are looking to speak to candidates who are based in New York City, NY for our hybrid working model.
Responsibilities:

Product Strategy and Ownership: Drive the complete lifecycle of the product, from defining vision and strategy to roadmap creation and execution; Align product direction with business priorities, IT architecture, and stakeholder needs; Define the "art of the possible," balancing quick wins with long-term improvements, and advocate for strategic innovation in data products
Requirements Gathering and Use Case Definition: Partner closely with stakeholders, including analysts, engineers, and product managers, to collect and document detailed business requirements; Interview diverse personas to determine use cases, user stories, and actionable solutions, ensuring stakeholder pain points are accurately captured
Stakeholder Collaboration and Advocacy: Serve as the voice of the user, gathering feedback and championing their needs; Develop and maintain strong partnerships across business units, engineering teams, and executive leadership. Provide clarity and transparency to the business on product progress, prioritization decisions, and roadblocks
Agile Product Management: Lead and drive agile ceremonies, from backlog grooming to sprint planning and retrospectives; Collaborate closely with technical teams to ensure timely and high-quality product delivery; Balance addressing tech debt while driving innovation and new feature development in sprints
Enablement and Long-Term Discoverability: Build user-friendly documentation and guides to drive product adoption and longevity; Communicate complex concepts in a manner easily understood across multiple audiences, ensuring discoverability and literacy of data products
Performance and Market Analysis: Define measurable product outcomes and success metrics. Continuously analyze data signals to inform innovation, roadmap prioritization, and product delivery; Conduct market research to stay up-to-date with industry trends and guide strategic direction for products and the Internal Data Platform
Product Marketing & Adoption: Announce product features and datasets through effective product marketing strategies and evangelization efforts, driving adoption across MongoDB teams; Re-launch features as needed to invigorate usage and showcase core capabilities
Change Management: Partner with change management and training teams to promote adoption of features and capabilities; Communicate product changes effectively and track KPI metrics for success

Requirements:

Experience: 5+ years of experience in product management, preferably in data products, or equivalent work experience with a proven ability to define product scope and collaborate with technical teams to deliver impactful solutions
Strategic Thinking: Demonstrated ability to align product roadmaps with business priorities, operational needs, and technical feasibility. Skilled at making trade-off decisions between scope, resources, and timelines
Stakeholder Empathy: Strong stakeholder-focused mindset, with a track record of understanding pain points, building partnerships, and translating insights into actionable requirements and solutions
Technical Strength: Deep understanding of data engineering, analytics, and UX fundamentals. Experience working with analysts, data scientists, engineers, product managers, and operators, with the ability to step into their shoes and anticipate their needs
Agility in Execution: Proficient in leading agile teams and ceremonies, managing technical dependencies, and driving continuous improvement of product processes and user experiences
Effective Communication: Exceptional written and verbal communication skills, enabling collaboration across diverse company audiences, both technical and non-technical
Growth Mindset: Adaptable, eager to take on challenges beyond the defined scope, highly organized, and detail-oriented to ensure thorough execution and delivery
Outcome-focused Approach: Strong focus on measurable product outcomes and iterative improvement, with the ability to define and monitor success metrics
Educational Background: B.Sc. in Computer Science or a related field preferred, or equivalent work experience in technology and product domains

Nice to Have:

Data Analytics Expertise: Experience with BI, data engineering, or analytics tools; enjoys digging into data for insights, progress validation, and new opportunities
Market Awareness: Keeps up-to-date with market trends in databases, data science, and software development, influencing product strategies accordingly
User Enablement: Skilled in creating guides, documentation, and onboarding materials for stakeholders, driving long-term stakeholder productivity
Evangelization Passion: Demonstrates enthusiasm for promoting, re-launching, and driving adoption of products, datasets, and features
Metadata Management Knowledge: Understands the importance of metadata creation and documentation for long-term discoverability and literacy of data products

This role is responsible for overseeing our new company liability credit card program, managing all aspects of our global travel program, and leading our expense audit process. The ideal candidate will be a seasoned professional with a deep understanding of card programs, a proven track record in global travel management, and expertise in expense compliance and auditing. This role requires a hands-on leader who can manage a diverse team, drive change, and operate effectively in a fast-paced, complex, and global environment. We are looking to speak to candidates who are based in Dublin for our hybrid working model.
Key Responsibilities: What Youll Be Doing 
Credit Card Program Management:


Lead the strategic design, implementation, and ongoing management of our new company pay liability credit card program (Brex)
Develop and enforce all policies and procedures related to card issuance, usage, and termination
Partner with our card provider to optimize the platform, manage account relationships, and leverage data analytics for program insights
Implement and manage card controls, spending limits, and real-time alerts to ensure policy compliance and prevent misuse
Oversee fraud prevention, investigation, and dispute resolution processes for all card transactions
Serve as the primary subject matter expert and change leader for the new card program, driving adoption and providing training to employees


Global Travel Program Management:


Manage all facets of the global travel program for an enterprise of over 5,000 employees, including policy development, vendor relationships, and technology platform oversight
Negotiate and manage contracts with airlines, hotels, car rental companies, and global travel management companies (TMCs) to optimize costs and enhance traveler experience
Continuously analyze travel data and market trends to identify cost-saving opportunities and refine travel policies
Ensure the safety and security of all business travelers by integrating with travel risk management platforms and providing clear communication protocols
Act as the key business partner to internal stakeholders, including executive leadership, procurement, finance, and human resources, to align travel policies with business needs
Oversee the travel analyst team, providing guidance and mentorship on vendor management, data analysis, and program improvements


Expense Audit Process Management:


Own the end-to-end expense audit process, ensuring accuracy, compliance, and efficiency
Lead the Manager of Expense Audit and their team, providing strategic direction on audit scope, methodologies, and reporting
Leverage AI-powered audit software (e.g., AppZen, Oversight) to identify high-risk transactions, detect fraud, and automate the audit process
Develop and implement a robust system for tracking policy violations, managing exceptions, and providing a clear audit trail
Collaborate with internal audit, compliance, and tax teams to ensure the expense program meets all regulatory and internal control requirements (e.g., SOX)
Provide regular, data-driven insights and reporting on expense spend, policy compliance rates, and audit findings to senior management


Qualifications: What Well Need to See 

Bachelor's degree in Finance, Business Administration, Accounting, or a related field
Minimum of 8-10 years of experience in travel, card, and expense management, with at least 5 years in a senior managerial role at a large, global enterprise (5,000+ employees)
Certified Corporate Travel Executive, CCTE
Demonstrated expertise in implementing and managing corporate credit card programs, preferably with a company pay liability model
Strong experience in global travel management, including negotiating with and managing a full suite of travel vendors (airlines, hotels, TMCs)
Proven experience in managing a team, including both direct reports and managers, with a focus on mentorship and professional development
Deep knowledge of expense audit processes, policy compliance, and fraud detection
Experience with and a strong understanding of modern T&E technology platforms (e.g., Concur, Brex, Ramp) and AI-powered audit tools (e.g., AppZen, Oversight)
Exceptional analytical skills with the ability to translate complex data into actionable business insights
Excellent communication, negotiation, and stakeholder management skills
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, high-growth environment with competing priorities

How To Stand Out From Other Candidates 

Hands-on experience implementing a company pay card and understanding the challenges that comes with a new company liability card solution
Experience undertaking transformation of current processes
Working knowledge of modern card and expense solutions
Deep experience negotiating with hotels, airlines, large venues
Demonstrated experience with AI audit software
Experience with large ERP systems such as NetSuite, Oracle, SAP, or Workday
Experience using Navan
Excellent presentation skills (both oral and written)
High attention to detail
Ability to operate in a dynamic and ambiguous environment (e.g. able to quickly adapt to changing priorities)

Define standards and vision for the mission-critical observability platform leveraged by all parts of the engineering organization

Design, implement, and troubleshoot the monitoring of services that seamlessly spans the globe - including several cloud providers
Build for reliability, making services and infrastructure available, resilient, fault tolerant and self-healing
Identify and configure key metrics to detect incidents and quantify service health, availability and performance.
Participate in a week-long on-call rotation and blameless post-mortem process
Improve our observability capabilities, optimizing for cost, ease of use, and maintainability

Requirements

Experience running mission critical services at scale
Experience with observability of large scale distributed systems
An understanding of information security issues
Firm grasp of at least one modern programming language, beyond basic scripting
Solid understanding of web and network protocols and standards (HTTP, TLS, DNS, etc)
Bachelors degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience

Nice to haves

Experience with at least one of the major cloud providers (Amazon Web Services, Google Compute, Microsoft Azure)
Experience working in a kubernetes-based environment kubernetes clusters

Generous compensation package
